goals.question: What is the distribution of volcano elevation?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of elevation of the volcanoes in the dataset and how many volcanoes fall within each elevation range.

goals.question: What is the relationship between volcano elevation and type?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a significant difference in elevation between different types of volcanoes. It will also help us identify any outliers in the dataset.

goals.question: What is the distribution of volcano type?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of each type of volcano in the dataset and identify any dominant types.

goals.question: What is the relationship between volcano type and country?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of different types of volcanoes across different countries. It will also help us identify any countries with a high concentration of a particular type of volcano.

goals.question: What is the relationship between volcano type and last known eruption?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of 'Last Known Eruption' vs 'Type'
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is any correlation between the type of volcano and the time since its last known eruption. It will also help us identify any outliers in the dataset.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='Elevation', bins=20)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of volcano elevation?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.boxplot(x='Type', y='Elevation', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between volcano elevation and type?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.countplot(x='Type', data=data)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of volcano type?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    chart = sns.countplot(x='Country', hue='Type', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between volcano type and country?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        chart.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Last Known Eruption'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Last Known Eruption'], format='%Y', errors='ignore')
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='Type', y='Last Known Eruption')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the relationship between volcano type and last known eruption?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
